p: NS1 can exist in different oligomeric states. When it is associated with membranes, that is, in virus-induced vesicles or cell plasma membrane, NS1 exists in a dimeric form When NS1 is secreted out of the cell, sNS1 becomes a hexamer ( Gutsche et al., 2011). The structure is ~10 nm in diameter and 9 nm in height and exists as a barrel-like structure with dimers of sNS1 arranged as trimers and contain triglycerides, cholesterol, and charged lipids such as phosphatidylcholine and phosphatidylethanolamine ( Muller et al., 2012).
